reviewText: Parks and Recreation is one my favorite shows on t.v. at this moment! This might surprise some people, but I can honestly say that this show is in the same vain as "I Love Lucy". Of course not in terms of storyline or theme, but the writing is fresh, current, and unique. And the most important thing about Parks and Recreation is that it makes you laugh out loud, seriously! I haven't belly-laughed so much since the show I mentioned before, this show is THAT good! Love the effortless chemisty between Amy Poehler and Adam Scott, they are so cute! Rashida Jones, Nick Offerman, and the rest of the cast are a hoot! I've watched every season and Season 4 is my personal favorite. I highly recommend this offbeat comedy! I wish this show had more viewers, it's brilliant...enjoy!
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: Love Parks and Rec and this season is just as good as past seasons. Regularly re-watch episodes and am so happy they renewed the show!

reviewText: The happy tone of this series and it's sheer sense of fun is heart warming and always interesting because of the interaction between the really funny quirky characters who work together in a small town government office.Lots of good satire and very little insult comedy a sign of mature humor rather eighth grade humor made to look adult.This is a very enjoyable season in this really good comedy!
summary: Delightful workplace comedy packed with quirky characters
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: This show just makes me laugh out loud, laugh hard, sometimes brings on the laugh-tears, and it is just pure joy.  Such clever, original writing, funny characters, and - well- we just love the whole thing. Rumors keep coming up that it won't be back on TV, which is just crazy and only reflects the rotten stupidity of anyone who would make such a bone-headed decision.  The marvelous invention that is TV has been so abused and misused in so many different ways and on those rare, delicious occasions when something just takes those TV wave and uses them right, it needs to be continued and all who made it come true need to have praise and gratitude and lotsa big bucks!  I keep buying the DVDs whenever they come out because I want Amy Poehler and the whole cast and all who make this show to know that there are plenty of people out here - somewhere near Pawnee - who absolutely love to laugh and are very grateful to them for giving us what we love!  Buy these DVDs, folks; it's a priceless show!
summary: My whole family and I love this show so much!
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: Awesome show! If you haven't watched Parks and Rec, then you should start with Season 1. From the beginning, this show has taken off! A must buy!

reviewText: Amy and the entire ensemble (and the writers) continue to bring consistently funny performances and dialogue to the TV comedy world.  I hope this show runs for another 10 years--at least.  It manages to surprise me and make me laugh out loud, and that's rare in TV comedy these days.

reviewText: I would have never thought Parks and Rec would be this good, but it is.  I love the show.  That goes for all the seasons.  They're all good.  Amy Poehler's character is also very good, however, the character named Ron Swanson may be my all-time favorite.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: First of all, if you like The Office, skip all reviews and watch immediately.  This is similar to The Office in many ways (particularly it's "mockumentary" style) and is even funnier, especially as the seasons progress (reverse for The Office).  It somehow gets better and better, and the characters are some of the most likable, unique, and funniest on television, some in television history.Amy Poehler plays Leslie Knope, a very ambitious and goofy government employee who this season is trying to get on City Council.  In the first season the character was criticized for acting too dumb (think like Michael Scott, a bit), so they made her a little less ditzy going into season 2 and she's been sharpened more and more since then.  Leslie is still incredibly goofy, but it's much more evident now how smart she is.  Unlike Michael Scott in The Office, Leslie is super hard-working and sleeps 3 and 1/2 hours on average a night because she spends all of her time working.  Like Michael Scott, she has a crazy sweet tooth.I love Poehler and her portrayal of Leslie because it is so refreshing to have a non-sexualized woman as a lead role on a television show.  Poehler is a very pretty woman, no doubt, but she doesn't rely on her looks at all for this show.  She dresses very conservatively and I don't think we see even a hint of cleavage.  She is a super empowering female character and a great role model.Ron Swanson, played by Nick Offerman, has a crazy cult following and has been dubbed by many critics as one of the funniest characters in television history, and the relationship between him and Leslie is compared a lot to that of Mary and Lou's from The Mary Tyler Moore Show.  In the first season Ron wasn't as prevalent, but now he has nearly iconic status.  Ron hates the government, so is constantly FOR cutting spending and hates to work.  He hates fancy technology and pop culture and spends most of his free time woodworking, eating steak, fishing, hunting, etc.  He's the All-American manly man, and Offerman is so skilled in deadpan comedy.  The actor and character are also quite similar, especially their affinity to woodworking.  If you check out Offerman's Twitter, he closed it because it was a "mistake" and wanted to go out in nature instead.  This just adds to the uniqueness that is Ron Swanson.  My boyfriend is 40 and Ron Swanson is now his "hero," lol.  He really is hilarious.Aziz Ansari plays Tom Haverford, who is obsessed with making lots of money and what's hot and what's not.  He also is amazingly great and weird at coming up with business names and ideas.  Chris Pratt and Aubrey Plaza as married couple Andy Dwyer and April Ludgate respectively is one of the best decisions the showrunners have made for character development.  They complement each other, are fun and cute to watch, and most of all - hilarious.  Andy is dumber than ever.This is definitely one of the best comedies on television right now.  Some of my other favorites are It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, The Office, Psych, Louie, Wilfred, The League, Veep, and yet - this consistently gets a lot more laughs out of me every time.  And the show gets better as it goes on - it is seriously in its prime right now.  It also has amazing replay value, because it's a lot of fun to go back and rewatch these characters that you didn't know as well at first.
summary: "If you re-arrange the letters of Peru, you get Europe." - Andy Dwyer
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: What's not to like about Parks & Rec? No cutsey kids, singing, shooting, melodrama or, God forbid, dancing. Just extremely talented people who have created a troup of thoroughly engaging characters. Leslie Knope couldn't be supported by a better bunch of true friends as she overcomes all kinds of setbacks in her drive to be elected to the Pawnee City Council.

reviewText: I've been a fan of this series since episode one, and fortunately, it gets better every season. Number four is the best one yet!All the gang has returned, with favorites Ron "Rontaunamo Bay" Swanson, Andy "Mouserat" Dwyer, and Tom "Tommy Time" Haverford getting plenty of screen time with the likes of Leslie and Ann. This season also gets several appearances by none other than Paul Rudd, who does a great job as Bobby Newport, Leslie's chief rival for the seat of Pawnee City Council.And on the subject of City Council, this season features the strongest story arc yet, with plenty of hilarious antics engaged upon during the 22 episodes, while Leslie desperately tries to achieve her lifelong ambition. She pulls out all the stops, even when her campaign advisors leave her, and Parks staff is there to help. Even the surly Ron lends his mighty hand, mustache bristling as he dispenses strange, sage wisdom from the depths of his curious cranium.Remarkably, when the election finally arrives, and the group sees the end of its long, exhausting journey... I felt incredibly happy for them. Of course, I realized that I was watching an absurd, fictional campaign over the previous 22 episodes, yet the characters are so delightful, so wonderfully realized, and so endearing, I can't help but feel good when THEY feel good. This is the rare show that will make you laugh out loud, even if you're watching it by yourself. It's just that funny, and just that FUN!
summary: "I tried to make Ramen noodles in the coffee maker, and I broke everything." -Andy Dwyer
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: Excellent! The cast was wonderful like usual and it was hilarious as usual. I highly recommend this show and I can't wait for the new season to start!

reviewText: "Parks and Rec" is not for those expecting entertainment arising from realistic situations, but for those who appreciate and enjoy semi-realistic relationships set against ridiculous situations.  Maybe there are towns like Pawnee scattered all across the nation; maybe not.  But love and friendship surmount the silliness of government wall murals depicting women getting punched and Native Americans being butchered.  If you're looking for p.c., it ain't here; but hasn't escapism always been a strong basis for humor, especially in economically challenged times?The acting in this implausibly wonderful series is damn near flawless.  There are times a viewer might wish the characters weren't quite so obtuse, but you love 'em anyway.  You can't help but root for the romances (although Tom and Anne are definitely pushing it) and be frustrated by the tribulations.  This is, plain and simply, TV comedy at its best.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: Its good to see a show change its style from Season 1 to Season 2 and forge its own identity. I have a friend who is Ron Swanson, so emmy voters ingnore Nick Offermans performance as Ron Swanson, honestly Ron Swanson doesn't care. If nbc were smart (big if) they would've more to promote "community" & "parks & rec" together as a nice 1 two combo I'm happy that there will be a season 4 and for me the show started with season 2. Best episodes of Season 3 "Leslie's Painting". "Parks & Rec" is the best 30.00 you will spend.
summary: Seperated at birth Ron Swanson & Chuck Norris
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: Leslie's recent suspension from work forces her into relaxation for less than a day. At that point, Leslie can't take it anymore and decides to form a citizen action committee. Her new team, the Parks Committee of Pawnee (or PCP), starts to agitate and petition the government for park improvement.Another fun side story in this episode is the Christmas gift-giving within the Parks Department. As always, Leslie picks out wonderful, thoughtful gifts for everyone, so Ron tasks the entire office with thinking up the perfect gift for Leslie.Finally, poll results come back showing that Leslie's support for city council has fallen from 26% to 1%. The end of the show tracks Leslie's struggle with whether to drop out of the race or keep fighting.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: I think I mentioned in a previous review that I was not too impressed by the first couple of episodes of season one.But alas did that change. Season 4 is just an example of what good writing can do to keep the fans coming back for more.Can't get enough of Parks & Recreation

reviewText: I'm old enough to remember the, I Love Lucy Show, and I have to say it, this is the 21st century equivalent of that iconic comedy show.  There is that same goofiness;  the same hilarious situations, the same ideas of friendship, love, family, but what sets it apart is that it challenges perceived notions of these concepts, and it has a multi-racial cast, making it , to my mind, the 21st century heir to I Love LUcy.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: I am glad this series has continued on television. I have loved it from the start. However, watching with friends and family let me know it is not for everyone. Thank goodness there are more people that appreciate it than I could imagine. This cast can say more with a look than most show can do with an hour of dialogue. I love this show.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: I only got into Parks and Recreation over the summer, but I devoured three seasons worth of episodes on 10 days.  That's how awesome this show is.  Of course when I saw this preview up on Amazon for download, I clicked and watched.  My excitement level went from "So excited!" to "Oh my God I need to go celebrate this awesomeness at the Snakehole Lounge like right now."If you haven't watched Parks and Recreation yet, you should really rethink your choices in life because by not watching this show you're probably depriving your funny bone of one of the best medicines it could ever have.  And once you're done with season 3, watch this and prepare yourself for season 4.  Trust me, I wouldn't lead you astray.  If I wanted to do that, I'd tell you to watch Two and a Half Men and cringe through it.Parks and Recreation is one of the funniest shows on television, hands down, and this preview does not disappoint.
summary: Was already excited - this video sealed that.

reviewText: I have watched this sitcom from its very beginning and every episode is funny. It shows a dedicated and upbeat city employee in a small town, determined to keep her parks clean and keep everyone happy. Her co-workers include a supervisor who hates government, a young angst ridden goth chick, a self serving fashionista and a guy who is the butt of all jokes.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: This is by far the best show on TV.I enjoy a few shows--Modern Family, Sunny in Philly, New Girl and Happy Endings. I love each of those shows, but none of them touch the brilliance of Parks and Rec.Each character is wonderfully crafted by the writers and the actor. Each brings a genuine smile to my face and conveys a sense of optimism that is tough to explain.In a pretty cynical and pessimistic world, this show is the exact opposite. It not only provides laughs during each scene, but it really does raise my spirits.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: The fourth season of Parks and Recreation originally telecast in the United States on the NBC television network, and began on September 22, 2011. We had watched some snippets while flipping thru' local channels once in a while, but we watched it again on Amazon Instant Video in it's entirety in two days and liked it just as much as the previous seasons in the past.This Season 4 focused on Leslie Knope (by Amy Poehler) and her staff at the parks and recreation department of the Indiana town of Pawnee just like previous seasons. However, this season featured sequence of series installments much so like story arc, beginning in the first episode where Leslie ran for the city council of Pawnee. Rest assured there was plenty of laughs. Amy Poehler keeps us all glued to the screen. "Ron" Swanson character played by Nick Offerman gets better each season. Cannot wait till he consumes a whole buffalo in one gulp but fail miserably to eat a banana. Hilarious!Good Acting by everyone in the cast. Enjoyed it - Fun to watch if you like light comedy.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: As the show progresses through the seasons, it advances from amusing to hilarious.  There is not a ho-hum character in the show and the writers make excellent use of the their quirky personalities.  Amy Poehler is wonderful as the kingpin around which the action revolves but she does not hog the limelight.  If you want to put your troubles aside, just tune in to the foibles of the citizens of Pawnee, Indiana and you will see your problems are forgettable. Many laughs await; just give it a try.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: P&R continues good humor and good story line. TY & keep up the good work! I will continue to watch. :D  BIG smile

reviewText: Parks and Rec is always hilarious, everyone knows that. Between the great Ron Swanson, Leslie, Andy, and every other character on the show, Parks is one of the finest comedies currently on television. Season four showed no drop in quality whatsoever. And on top of all of the brilliant comedy, it also had some very touching emotional moments that are hard to forget. I love this show!!And how can I forget to mention Paul Rudd's fantastic performance as Bobby Newport Jr! The guy was hilarious and I predict a best guest actor in a comedy Emmy nod for him!

reviewText: Who would have thought 3 years ago that Parks and Recreation would one day be better than The Office?  To anyone who has seen Seasons 2 or 3 of Parks and Recreation, this shouldn't be a surprise; this show is one of the best comedies on air right now.And Season 4 does not disappoint.At the end of Season 3, Leslie Knope is asked to run for public office with city council elections on the horizon.  The first episode of Season 4 picks this thread up directly: the crux of this season centers around Leslie running for office.  Unlike previous seasons, this one has a very real and cogent through-line; every episode advances this storyline to some degree.  While some of these episodes are serialized in nature, they also do stand alone as fantastic episodes of television.  The writing on this show involves a great mixture of wit, awkwardness, absurdity, and sentiment.  While many of us were worried that the budding romance between Leslie and Ben would be cheesy and boring (e.g., Pam and Jim,) the writers don't drop the ball.With all of this said, I don't feel like Season 4 was quite as good as the previous two seasons.  This put off many long-time fans, but even with the slight decrease in quality, this season was still head and shoulders above most of today's television.  If you are a newcomer to the series, I would recommend starting from the beginning; not necessarily because you will miss too much of the story, but because the earlier seasons are just as funny (and sometimes funnier) than this one.  If, however, you have watched the previous seasons of Parks and Rec, Season 4 is worthy of your time, energy, and money.Recommended for fans of:  The Office, Community, Arrested Development.Particular highpoints of the season:Episode 2: Ron and Tammys (hilarious finale involving moonshine and Ron Swanson)Episode 15: Dave Returns (features the return of the awkward cop played by Louis C.K.)Episode 19: The Debate (the epic showdown between Ms. Knope and her opponent, Bobby Newport Jr.)Episode 21: Win, Lose or Draw (the satisfying conclusion to the campaign and the season)
summary: One of the Best Comedies on Television
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: From smiles to chuckles to laugh out loud thigh slapping snappy and sappy skits and skirmishes, Parks and Recreation always delivers. To have this dose of humor at your command with Amazon Prime, noticeably increases the enjoyment quotient. Warning: This program should be kept away from the humor challenged.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: The characters just keep getting better. I love Leslie and Ben! Actually, I love all of the crew. Ron Johnson would be a great boss to have.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four

reviewText: I love this show, and unfortunately most likely the upcoming season (season seven) will most likely be the last. Anyways I love how the show follows the work of someone dedicated to implementing change in the government, through different projects in the parks department for the better of the community. It works well, however the only technical problems I had, which occurred frequently, was when the sound would stop yet the video would remain playing. This issue occurs for other TV via Amazon prime too, so this problem should be fixed. Besides that issue it runs well, when the internet connection is good. Anyways this is a great great gift for those who enjoy Amy Poehler's comedy, though it can be slap stick funny at times, it truly is funny and is a great accomplishment for her as well as women comedians. I would definitely watch again.
Title: Parks and Recreation: Season Four
